thread.title: Red River Rivalry spills into social media world

title: Red River Rivalry spills into social media world

Image 14 of 14 Red River Rivalry spills into social media world 1 / 14 Back to Gallery The Red River Rivalry is one of college football's oldest and most contentious conflicts.
This year marks the 110th meeting between Oklahoma and Texas, with each team trending in opposite directions.
The fact that the Sooners are ranked No. 10 in the nation and the Longhorns have sputtered to a 1-4 record hasn't been lost on their rabid fan bases.
Longhorns alums have approached the game with a melancholy demeanor following a 50-7 shellacking at the hands of TCU last week.
Sooners faithful, on the other hand, haven't pulled any punches — they've even gone after poor BEVO, who had to miss the game due to a "life-threatening condition."
Click through the slides above to see the best — and worst — of social media leading up to this year's Red River Showdown.
